Problem

class pyrit.problem.Problem(description: str, mesh: Mesh, shape_function: ShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, boundary_conditions: BdryCond, excitations: Excitations)

Bases: object

General representation of a problem.

A general, non-specified problem.

Parameters

  • description (str) – A description of the problem

  • mesh (Mesh) – A mesh object. See pyrit.mesh.

  • shape_function (ShapeFunction) – A shape function object. See pyrit.shapefunction.

  • regions (Regions) – A regions object. See pyrit.regions.

  • materials (Materials) – A materials object. See pyrit.materials.

  • boundary_conditions (BdryCond) – A boundary conditions object. See pyrit.bdrycond.

  • excitations (Excitations) – An excitations object. See pyrit.excitation.

Methods

consistency_check

Check the consistency of the problem.

load

Load a problem.

save

Saves the problem instance.

solve_linear_system

Solve a system of linear equations.

Attributes

problem_identifier

Identifier for the __repr__ method.
problem_identifier: str = 'General problem'

Identifier for the __repr__ method.

solve_linear_system(rhs: Union[spmatrix, ndarray], solver: Optional[Union[str, Callable[[csr_matrix, csr_matrix], Tuple[ndarray, Dict[str, Any]]]]] = None, **kwargs) → Tuple[ndarray, Dict[str, Any]]

Solve a system of linear equations.

General method for solving a system of linear equations. The matrix and the right-hand-side (rhs) must be given. With solver, it can be determined how to solve the system. There are some predefined solvers. It can also be passed a function, if you want to provide your own solver. The signature has to be as defined.

Parameters

  • matrix (sparse.spmatrix) – The system matrix.

  • rhs (Union[sparse.spmatrix, np.ndarray]) – The right-hand-side vector

  • solver (Union[str, Callable[[sparse.csr_matrix, sparse.csr_matrix], Tuple[np.ndarray, Dict[str, Any]]]], optional) – The used solver. In the case of a string, use one of the predefined solvers. In the case of a function, make sure that the signature is as expected. The function gets the system matrix as first argument and the right-hand-side as second argument. It must return the solution as first value and a dictionary with information as second value. Furthermore, the kwargs are passed to the function.

  • kwargs – kwargs passed to the solver.

Returns

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution of the system of linear equations.

  • info (Dict[str, Any]) – A dictionary with information from the solver.

consistency_check()

Check the consistency of the problem.

It is checked if for every region there is a related material, boundary condition or excitation in the corresponding data structure.

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → Path

Saves the problem instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) – The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) – A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. By default, all attributes are included.

Returns

path – The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → Problem

Load a problem.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) –

The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

problem – A problem instance.

Return type

Problem
